New Records: India secured their second T20 World Cup victory, ending a 13-year wait.
Virat Kohli scored 76 runs in the first innings.
Jasprit Bumrah took crucial wickets and delivered under pressure.
Key Match Events: Nail-biting final with high-pressure moments in the last few overs.
Hardik Pandya's decisive over leading to the victory.
Clutch catch by Suryakumar Yadav to seal the win.
Pre-Game Insights: India's head coach Rahul Dravid promoted Shivam Dube and Axar Patel in key moments.
Rohit Sharma highlighted the importance of the team's resilience and fan support.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's performance and relief at the victory.
Aiden Markram described the loss as gut-wrenching, highlighting the emotional journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was India's first T20 World Cup win since 2007 and second overall.
Rahul Dravid's final match as head coach was significant.
Others: The match was held in Barbados, marking a redemption for India after their previous World Cup heartbreak.
